sen.j: 大内 義興（おおうち よしおき）は室町時代後期から戦国時代 (日本)にかけての周防国の戦国大名。
sen.e: Yoshioki OUCHI was the feudal lord of Suo-no-kuni who ruled from the Muromachi to the Sengoku Period.
Yoshioki OUCHI was the daimyo (feudal lord) of Suo-no-kuni who lived from the end of the Muromachi Period to the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: Added 'daimyo''ruled'→'lived'Added 'the end of'
sen.e: Yoshioki OUCHI was the daimyo (feudal lord) of Suo Province who lived from the end of the Muromachi period to the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Suo-no-kuni → Suo Province Period → period

sen.j: 大内氏の第30代当主。
sen.e: The thirtieth family head of the Ouchi clan.
He was the thirtieth family head of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: Added 'He was'
sen.e: He was the thirtieth family head of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Brief Biography → Brief Personal History

sen.j: 父は周防守護で大内氏の第29代当主・大内政弘。
sen.e: His father was Suo Shugo and the twenty ninth clan head, Masahiro OUCHI.
His father was the Shugo (governor) of Suo and the twenty ninth clan head, Masahiro OUCHI.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderAdded definition of 'Shugo'
sen.e: His father was the Shugo (provincial constable) of Suo and the twenty ninth clan head, Masahiro OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 「守護」 用語集の表記に修正 Shugo (governor) → Shugo (provincial constable)「当主」 用語集の表記に修正 clan head → family head

sen.j: 弟に大内隆弘（高弘）。
sen.e: His younger brother was Takahito (spelled both 隆弘 and 高弘 in Japanese) OUCHI.
His younger brother was Takahito (written both 隆弘 and 高弘 in Japanese) OUCHI.
sen.cmt: spelled'→'written' but don't know if the kanji are necessary for English speakers
sen.e: His younger brother was Takahito (written both 隆弘 and 高弘 in Japanese) OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 漢字を理解できる英語話者もいらっしゃいますので、個人的には漢字表記はあってもよいと思われます。

sen.j: 正室は長門守護代・内藤弘矩の娘。
sen.e: His legal wife was the daughter of Nagato Shugodai (substitute ruler of the country) Hironori NAITO.
His legal wife was the daughter of the Shugo-dai (deputy governor) of Nagato, Hironori NAITO.
sen.cmt: Changed definition of 'Shugodai'
sen.e: His legal wife was the daughter of the Shugodai (the acting Military Governor) of Nagato, Hironori NAITO.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Shugo-dai (deputy governor) → Shugodai (the acting Military Governor)

sen.j: 子に大内義隆、娘（大友義鑑室、のちに大内義長がこの間に生まれる）。
sen.e: His children were Yoshitaka OUCHI and daughter (the wife of Toshiaki OTOMO who had Yoshinaga OUCHI with him).
His children were Yoshitaka OUCHI and daughter (the wife of Toshiaki OTOMO and, later, mother of Yoshinaga OUCHI).
sen.cmt: Added 'a''who had Yoshinaga OUCHI with him'→'and, later, mother of Yoshinaga OUCHI'
sen.e: His children were Yoshitaka OUCHI and daughter (the wife of Toshiaki OTOMO and, later, mother of Yoshinaga OUCHI).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 幼名は亀童丸。
sen.e: His childhood name is Kidomaru.
His childhood name was Kidomaru.
sen.cmt: is'→'was'
sen.e: His childhood name was Kidomaru.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 室町幕府の管領代となって将軍の後見人となり、周防・長門・石見・安芸・筑前・豊前・山城の7ヶ国の守護職を兼ね、織田信長らが登場する前の戦国時代前期の事実上の天下人として君臨した。
sen.e: He became the legal guardian to his shogun by becoming the Kanrei-dai (substitute for the highest post in shogunate under shogun) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and worked as Shugoshoku (ruler of the country) title of seven kuni (countries) of Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Aki, Chikuzen, Buzen, and Yamashiro to reign as Tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country) during the early Sengoku period prior to the appearance of Nobunaga ODA.

As the Kanrei-dai (vice Shogunal deputy) and protector of the shogun, and the Shugo of the seven provinces of Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Aki, Chikuzen, Buzen, and Yamashiro, he was one of the great men of the early Warring States period prior to the appearance of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: As the kanreidai (representative of a shogunal deputy) and protector of the shogun, and the Shugo of the seven provinces of Suo, Nagato, Iwami, Aki, Chikuzen, Buzen, and Yamashiro, he was one of the great men of the early the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) prior to the appearance of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: 「管領代」 ハイフンを削除 説明を用語集の説明に修正 (vice Shogunal deputy) → (representative of a shogunal deputy) 統一リストの表記に修正 Warring States period → the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States)

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Life→Biography

tit.e: The Succession of a Family Estate.
tit.cmt: Deleted 'the' and ' of a Family Estate'
ピリオドを削除 Succession. → Succession

sen.j: 文明9年（1477年）、大内氏の第29代当主・大内政弘の子として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the son of Masahiro Ouchi, the 29th family head of the Ouchi clan in 1477.
He was born in 1477, the son of Masahiro Ouchi, the 29th family head of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: Moved dateDeleted 'as'
sen.e: He was born in 1477, the son of Masahiro Ouchi, the twenty ninth family head of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: the 29th → the twenty ninth

sen.j: 明応元年（1492年）、六角討伐戦に参戦する。
sen.e: He joined the Battle of Rokkaku Punitive Expedition in 1492.
In 1492 he took part in the battle to punish the Rokkaku clan.
sen.cmt: Moved date'joined'→'took part in''Battle of Rokkaku Punitive Expedition'→'battle to punish the Rokkaku clan'
sen.e: In 1492 he took part in the battle to punish the Rokkaku clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明応3年（1494年）、父・政弘が病気により隠居したため、家督を譲られて大内氏の第30代当主となる。
sen.e: As his father retired due to illness in 1494, he inherited the family estate and became the thirtieth family head of the Ouchi Clan.
When his father retired due to illness in 1494, he inherited the family estate and became the thirtieth family head of the Ouchi Clan.
sen.cmt: As'→'when'
sen.e: When his father retired due to illness in 1494, he inherited the family estate and became the thirtieth family head of the Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正Ouchi Clan → Ouchi clan

sen.j: 明応4年（1495年）、父が死去すると、長門守護代の内藤弘矩が弟の大内隆弘を擁立しようとしたと陶武護（陶興房の兄）に讒言され、それを信じて弘矩と内藤弘和を誅殺してしまった。
sen.e: When his father passed away in 1495, Takemori SUE (Okifusa SUE's older brother) placed a false charge against Nagato Shugodai Hironori NAITO and claimed that he supported younger brother of Yoshioki, Takahito OUCHI, which Yoshioki believed and executed Hironori and Takahito NAITO by mistake.

When his father died in 1495, Takemori SUE (Okifusa SUE's older brother) falsely charged the Nagato Shugodai, Hironori NAITO, of supporting Yoshioki's younger brother, Takahito OUCHI, leading Yoshioki to have Hironori and his son, Takahito NAITO, executed.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: When his father died in 1495, Takemori SUE (Okifusa SUE's older brother) falsely charged the Nagato Shugodai, Hironori NAITO, of supporting Yoshioki's younger brother, Takahito OUCHI, leading Yoshioki to have Hironori and his son, Takahito NAITO, executed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、後に内藤親子の冤罪を知り、讒言した武護を誅殺し、弘矩の娘を正室に迎えて内藤氏を再興させている。
sen.e: However, he later learned of the false charges against Naito father and child, executed Takemori who made the those accusations, and married daughter of Hironori as his legal wife to restore the Naito clan.
However, upon learning the charges against the NAITOs were false, he executed their accuser, Takemori, and took the daughter of Hironori as his legal wife to restore the Naito clan.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: However, upon learning the charges against the NAITOs were false, he executed their accuser, Takemori, and took the daughter of Hironori as his legal wife to restore the Naito clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: trans 1および2がそれぞれ一行下のセル（29行目）に記載されていたので、28行目に戻しました。

sen.j: 北九州で大友氏や少弐氏らと合戦を繰り広げながら、父の代の領土であった周防、長門、豊前、筑前に加え、安芸、石見の守護職を兼ねるほかに肥前国の一部にも勢力を広げた。
sen.e: While he continued to engage in battles with Otomo and Shoni clans in Kitakyushu, he ruled Suo, Nagato, Buzen, Chikuzen, Aki, and Iwami of his father's estate, and expanded his power to a part of Higo-no-kuni.

While engaging in battles with the Otomo and Shoni clans in Kitakyushu, he added Aki and Iwami to his father's estate of Suo, Nagato, Buzen and Chikuzen, and expanded his power to a part of Higo-no-kuni.
sen.cmt: he continued to engage'→'engaging'Added 'the'Changed word order due to mistranslation
sen.e: While engaging in battles with the Otomo and Shoni clans in northern Kyushu, he added title of Shugoshiki (military governor) of Aki and Iwami to his father's estate of Suo, Nagato, Buzen and Chikuzen, and expanded his power to a part of Higo Province as well.
sen.cmt: 「北九州」 ここでは地名としての「北九州（Kitakyushu）」ではなく、「九州北部」の意味と思われます。よって、以下の通り修正いたしました。Kitakyushu → northern Kyushu統一リストの表記に修正 Higo-no-kuni → Higo Province「守護職を兼ねる」が訳漏れのため、 added の後に the title of Shugoshiki (military governor) of を追記「ほかに（備前国の一部に）も」が訳漏れのため、 to a part of Higo Province の後に as well を追記

sen.j: 明応5年（1496年）には大友氏の内紛に介入して大友政親を処刑し、自らが擁立する大友大聖院宗心を大友家の後継者にしようとしたが、大友親治の反抗によって失敗している。
sen.e: He intervened in the internal conflict of Otomo clan in 1496 to execute Masachika OTOMO, and attempted to assign his supporter Otomo-daishoin Soshin as the Otomo clan successor but failed when faced with the resistant from Chikaharu OTOMO.

He intervened in the internal conflict of the Otomo clan in 1496 to execute Masachika OTOMO, but his attempt to assign Daishoinsoshin OTOMO, whom he supported, as the Otomo clan successor failed in the face of resistance from Chikaharu OTOMO.
sen.cmt: Added 'the'Changed word orderDeleted 'but''when faced with the resistant'→'in the face of resistance'
sen.e: He intervened in the internal conflict of the Otomo clan in 1496 to execute Masachika OTOMO, but his attempt to assign Daishoinsoshin OTOMO, whom he supported, as the Otomo clan successor failed in the face of resistance from Chikaharu OTOMO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明応6年（1497年）1月には少弐政資・少弐高経親子を攻め、4月に両名を自害に追い込んで北九州に勢力を拡大した。
sen.e: He attacked Masasuke and Takatsune SHONI (son of Masasuke) in January 1497, which drove them to their suicide in April, and expanded his power in Kitakyushu.
He attacked Masasuke and his son, Takatsune SHONI, in January 1497, leading to their suicides in April, and expanded his power in Kitakyushu.
sen.cmt: (son of Masasuke)'→'his son,' and moved'which drove them'→'leading'Made 'suicide' plural
sen.e: He attacked Masasuke and his son, Takatsune SHONI, in February 1497, leading to their suicides in April, and expanded his power in northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: Kitakyushu → northern KyushuJanuary →Februaryに変更しました。

sen.j: しかし政資の三男・少弐資元が文亀元年（1501年）に挙兵し、永正3年（1506年）には大友親治と連合して大内領に侵攻する気配を示した。
sen.e: However, third son of Masasuke, Sukemoto SHONI raised an army in 1501, which allied with Chikaharu OTOMO in 1506, and showed signs of invasion into the Ouchi estate.
However, Masasuke's third son, Sukemoto SHONI, raised an army in 1501, which allied with Chikaharu OTOMO in 1506, and showed signs of attacking the Ouchi estate.
sen.cmt: Deleted 'of'Changed word orderAdded comma'invasion into'→'attacking'
sen.e: However, Masasuke's third son, Sukemoto SHONI, raised an army in 1501, which allied with Chikaharu OTOMO in 1506, and showed signs of attacking the Ouchi estate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし明応8年（1500年）には前将軍で、明応の政変で京都を追われた足利義稙を山口に保護していたため、義興は永正4年（1507年）に義稙の仲介により少弐資元と和睦し、北九州の勢力を保っている。
sen.e: Nevertheless, since Yoshioki was protecting the former Shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, who escaped from Kyoto after Mei-O no seihen (Rebellion of Mei-O) in Tamaguchi in 1500, Yoshioki made a truce with Sukemoto SHONI with help of Yoshitane and maintained his power at Kitakyushu.

However, in 1500 Yoshioki was in Yamaguchi, protecting the former Shogun, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, who had fled Kyoto after the Mei-O Rebellion (Mei-O no seihen), and therefore Yoshioki, with help of Yoshitane, made a truce with Sukemoto SHONI, maintaining his power in Kitakyushu.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderCorrected 'Tamaguchi' to Yamaguchi''escaped'→'fled''at'→'in'
sen.e: However, Yoshioki was in Yamaguchi in 1500 protecting former Shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, who had fled Kyoto after the Meio no seihen (Meio Coup), so Yoshioki, with the help of Yoshitane, reconciled with Sukemoto SHONI in 1507, enabling him to maintain power in northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 調査指示書の入力要領に従い変更 Mei-O Rebellion → Meio Coup 「永正4年（1507年）」訳漏れのため in 1507 を追記Neilさん※ made a truce' は「停戦した」という意味であり、「和睦」とは少々ニュアンスが異なるように感じられるため、'was reconciled'にしました。ご確認お願いします。

tit.e: Invasion of Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto)
tit.cmt: 「畿内」の訳を用語集に従って修正 Kinai (area around Kyoto) →Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto)

sen.j: 永正4年（1507年）6月、足利義澄を第11代将軍に擁立して幕政を牛耳っていた細川政元が暗殺された。
sen.e: In June 1507, Masamoto HOSOKAWA, who controlled the shogunate government by supporting the assignment of Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA to the Eleventh Shogun, was assassinated.
In June 1507, Masamoto HOSOKAWA, who had gained control of the shogunate government by helping Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA become the Eleventh Shogun, was assassinated.
sen.cmt: controlled the shogunate government by supporting the assignment of Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA to the'→'who had gained control of the shogunate government by helping Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA become'
sen.e: In July 1507, Masamoto HOSOKAWA, who had gained control of the shogunate government by helping Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA become the Eleventh Shogun, was assassinated.
sen.cmt: June →Julyに変更しました。

sen.j: その後も細川氏内部では抗争が続いたため、畿内進出の好機と見た義興は、九州・中国の諸大名に動員令を発し、11月には山口から進発し、12月に備後国にまで進出した。
sen.e: The internal conflict continued within the Hosokawa clan, and Yoshioki saw this as the opportunity to invade Kinai and ordered the mobilization of Kyushu and Chugoku feudal lords to depart Yamaguchi in November and advanced into Bingo-no-kuni by December.

Yoshioki saw the resulting internal conflict within the Hosokawa clan as a good opportunity to invade Kinai and, after ordering the mobilization of daimyo from Kyushu and Chugoku, departed Yamaguchi in November and had advanced into Bingo-no-kuni by December.
sen.cmt: Moved 'Yoshioki saw' to the start Added 'good''ordered'→'after ordering' 'feudal lords'→'daimyo'Added 'ed' to 'depart' Added 'had'
sen.e: Yoshioki saw the resulting internal conflict within the Hosokawa clan as a good opportunity to invade Kinai region and, after ordering the mobilization of daimyo from Kyushu and Chugoku regions, departed Yamaguchi in December and had advanced into Bingo Province by January of the following year.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Kinai → Kinai region Kyushu and Chugoku → Kyushu and Chugoku regions Bingo-no-kuni → Bingo ProvinceNovember →Decemberに変更しました。December→January of the following yearに変更しました。

sen.j: これに対して細川家では、政元の養子であった細川高国が義興と通じて細川澄元と対立・抗争し、永正5年（1508年）3月に澄元は高国・義興らに圧迫され、足利義澄と共に近江国に逃走した。
sen.e: The adopted son of Masamoto, Takakuni HOSOKAWA, allied with Yoshioki to oppose and suppressed Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, who escaped to Omi-no-kuni with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in March 1508.
Masamoto's adopted son, Takakuni HOSOKAWA, allied with Yoshioki to oppose and resist Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, who escaped to Omi-no-kuni with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in March 1508.
sen.cmt: The adopted son of'→''s adopted son'
sen.e: In response, at the HOSOKAWAs, Masamoto's adopted son, Takakuni HOSOKAWA, allied with Yoshioki to oppose and resist Sumimoto HOSOKAWA, who escaped to Omi Province with Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in March 1508.
sen.cmt: 「これに対して細川家では」訳漏れのため、In response, at the HOSOKAWAs, を追記統一リストの表記に修正 Omi-no-kuni → Omi Province

sen.j: 6月に上洛を果たした義興は、7月には義稙を将軍職に復帰させ、自らも左京大夫・管領代として高国と共に幕政を執行する立場になったのである。
sen.e: Yoshiaki who managed to joraku (move to Kyoto from a rural district) in June, reassigned Yoshizumi to shogunship in July, and controlled shogunate with Takakuni as the head of Sankyo-no-daibu (chief of Sakyoshiki (governmental post at Sakyo or eastern Kyoto) government agency) and Kanreidai.

Yoshioki reached Kyoto in June, handed back the shogunship to Yoshitane in July though, as Sakyo-no-daibu (High Steward of East Kyoto) and Kanrei-dai, he, along with Takakuni, controlled the government.
sen.cmt: Corrected 'Yoshiaki' to 'Yoshioki'Corrected 'Yoshizumi' to 'Yoshtane'Not sure if 上洛 means 'enter Kyoto' or just 'reach Kyoto' in this case
sen.e: Yoshioki reached Kyoto in June, handed back the shogunship to Yoshitane in July though, as Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices) and Kanreidai, he, along with Takakuni, controlled the government.
sen.cmt: 「左京大夫」を用語集に従い修正 Sakyo-no-daibu (High Steward of East Kyoto) → Sakyo no daibu (Master of the Eastern Capital Offices)

sen.j: しかし細川澄元らは京都奪還を目指してたびたび反攻（如意ケ嶽の戦い）してくる。
sen.e: However, Sumimoto HOSOKAWA group frequently retaliated (the Battle of Nyoigatake) in order to regain Kyoto.
However, Sumimoto HOSOKAWA frequently launched counter attacks (the Battle of Nyoigatake) to try and regain Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Deleted 'group''retaliated'→'launched counter attacks'
sen.e: However, Sumimoto HOSOKAWA frequently launched counter attacks (the Battle of Nyoigatake) to try and regain Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 永正7年（1510年）1月には高国と共に近江に侵攻するが、逆に敗北してしまった。
sen.e: He invaded Omi with Takakuni in January 1510 but was defeated in return.
Yoshioki invaded Omi with Takakuni in January 1510 but was defeated.
sen.cmt: He'→'Yoshiaki'Deleted 'in return'
sen.e: Yoshioki invaded Omi with Takakuni in February 1510 but was defeated by contraries.
sen.cmt: 「逆に」の訳漏れ → by contraries を追記January→Februaryに変更しました。

sen.j: これにより義澄方は一大決戦を決意し、永正8年（1511年）7月には摂津に侵攻して決戦を挑んでくる。
sen.e: Seeing this, Yoshizumi decided to declare a war and invaded to Settsu to battle in July 1511.
Seeing this, Yoshizumi decided to declare war and invaded Settsu in July 1511.
sen.cmt: Deleted 'a' 'to' 'to battle'
sen.e: Seeing this, Yoshizumi decided to declare war and invaded Settsu in August 1511.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 摂津 Settsu → Settsu ProvinceJuly →Augustに変更しました。

sen.j: これに対して義興は高国と共に迎撃するも、摂津でも和泉国でも敗北して丹波国に逃走した。
sen.e: Yoshioki and Takakuni attacked but was defeated in both Settsu and Izumi-no-kuni that they escaped to Tanba-no-kuni.
Yoshioki and Takakuni attacked but were defeated at both Settsu and Izumi-no-kuni and they escaped to Tanba-no-kuni.
sen.cmt: was'→'were''in'→'at''that'→'and'
sen.e: Yoshioki and Takakuni attacked but were defeated at both Settsu and Izumi Province and they escaped to Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 和泉国 Izumi-no-kuni → Izumi Province 丹波国 Tanba -no-kuni → Tanba Province

sen.j: しかし8月14日に義澄が急死するなどの好条件にも助けられて、8月23日に船岡山城の決戦で澄元軍を破り、京都を奪還したのである（船岡山の戦い）。
sen.e: However, luck was on his side when Yoshizumi died suddenly in August 14, defeated Sumimoto army at the battle at Funaokayama Castle on August 23, and regained Kyoto (the Battle of Funaokayama).

However, luck was on their side when Yoshizumi died suddenly in August 14, then they defeated Sumimoto's army in a decisive battle at Funaokayama Castle on August 23, and retook Kyoto (the Battle of Funaokayama).
sen.cmt: his'→'their'Added 'then they''at the'→'in a decisive''regained'→'retook'
sen.e: However, luck was on their side when Yoshizumi died suddenly in September 16, then they defeated Sumimoto's army in a decisive battle at Funaokayama Castle on September 25, and retook Kyoto (the Battle of Funaokayama).
sen.cmt: August 14→September 16に変更しました。August 23→September 25に変更しました。

sen.j: このときの義興の活躍は相当のものだったようであり、永正9年（1512年）3月にはその武功により、従三位に昇位されて公卿に列せられた。
sen.e: The battle achievement of Yoshioki must have been great for he was promoted to the Jusani rank and was placed together with Kugyo.
Yoshioki's achievements of this period must have been considerable for he was promoted to the third rank at court, on a par with the Kugyo (nobles).
sen.cmt: Changed word orderDeleted 'battle'Added 's', 'of this period'J'usani rank and was placed together with Kugyo'→'third rank at court, on a par with the Kugyo (nobles)'
sen.e: Yoshioki's achievements of this period must have been considerable for he was promoted to the third rank at court, on a par with the Kugyo (nobles) in March 1512.
sen.cmt: 「永正9年（1512年）3月」 訳漏れのため追記

sen.j: しかし次第に将軍・義稙や細川高国と不仲になり、さらに領国の石見国や安芸国に対して出雲国の尼子経久が侵攻を開始してきたため、永正15年（1518年）8月2日に管領代を辞して山口に帰国した。
sen.e: However, his relation with Shogun Yoshizumi and Takakuni HOSOKAWA gradually worsened, and Tsunehisa AMAGO of Izumo-no-kuni invaded into his estate of Iwami and Aki-no-kuni that he retired his job as Kanrei-dai and returned to Tamaguchi.

However, with his relationships with Shogun Yoshizumi and Takakuni HOSOKAWA gradually worsening, and Tsunehisa AMAGO of Izumo-no-kuni invading his estates of Iwami-no-kuni and Aki-no-kuni, he retired from the post of Kanrei-dai and returned to Yamaguchi.
sen.cmt: Added 'with''relation'→'relationships''worsened'→'worsening''invaded'→'invading'added 's'Deleted 'that''his job as'→'from the post of'Corrected 'Tamaguchi' to Yamaguchi'
sen.e: However, with his relationships with Shogun Yoshizumi and Takakuni HOSOKAWA gradually worsening, and Tsunehisa AMAGO of Izumo province invading his estates of Iwami province and Aki province, he retired from the post of Kanrei-dai and returned to Yamaguchi.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 Izumo-no-kuni → Izumo Province Iwami-no-kuni → Iwami Province Aki-no-kuni → Aki Province

tit.e: The Battle with the Amago Clan.
The Battle with the Amago Clan.
The Battle with the Amago Clan
tit.cmt: 文末のピリオドを削除

sen.j: 義興の留守中に勢力を伸ばしていた経久の勢いは衰えることが無く、大永3年（1523年）には石見の波志浦を攻略され、安芸では大内家に従属していた毛利氏が尼子方に寝返った。
sen.e: Tsunehisa, who expanded his power during Yoshioki's absence, did not seem to weaken the force and defeated Hashiura of Iwami, and Mori clan who belonged to the Ouchi family betrayed and switched to the side of Amago.

Tsunehisa, who had increased his power during Yoshioki's absence, was not weakened by Yoshioki's return and, in 1523, captured Hashiura in Iwami, and the Mori clan of Aki, who were subordinates of the Ouchi family, switched sides to the Amago clan.
sen.cmt: expanded'→'had increased'Added 'by Yoshioki's return'―not in original but needed to make senseAdded 'in 1523''defeated'→'captured''of'→'in'added 'the''belonged to'→'were subordinates of'
sen.e: Tsunehisa, who had increased his power during Yoshioki's absence, was not weakened by Yoshioki's return and, in 1523, captured Hashiura in Iwami, and the Mori clan of Aki, who were subordinates of the Ouchi family, switched sides to the Amago clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 経久は毛利氏の当主・毛利幸松丸の後見役である毛利元就を利用して、大内氏の安芸経営の拠点である安芸西条の鏡山城を攻略させるなどして、一時は大内氏を圧倒した。
sen.e: Tsunehisa used Motonari MORI, the successor to the head of the Mori clan, Komatsumaru MORI, and conquered Kagamiyama Castle of Aki-Saijyo, the headquarter of Ouchi clan control in Aki.
Using Motonari MORI, the guardian of the head of the Mori clan, Komatsumaru MORI, Tsunehisa was able to capture Kagamiyama-jo Castle in Aki-Saijyo, the center of Ouchi clan control in Aki.
sen.cmt: Changed word order'successor'→'guardian''conquered'→'was able to capture''headquarter'→'center'
sen.e: Using Motonari MORI, the guardian of the head of the Mori clan, Komatsumaru MORI, Tsunehisa was able to capture Kagamiyama-jo Castle in Aki-Saijyo, the center of Ouchi clan control in Aki.
sen.cmt: 調査指示書の入力要領に従い修正 Kagamiyama Castle → Kagamiyama-jo Castle

sen.j: これに対して義興は大永元年（1521年）から安芸・石見に出兵して連年のように尼子氏と戦うが、思うように戦果が上がらなかった。
sen.e: As a result, Yoshioki sent his army to Aki and Iwami to battle with Amago clan for many years from 1521 but did not seem to achieve preferable war results.
As a result, in 1521, Yoshioki sent his army to Aki and Iwami but, although fighting the Amago clan for several years, he failed to achieve any favorable results.
sen.cmt: Moved 'in 1521''to battle with'→'but, although fighting''many'→'several''but did not seem to achieve preferable war'→'he failed to achieve any favorable'
sen.e: As a result, in 1521, Yoshioki sent his army to Aki and Iwami but, although fighting the Amago clan for several years, he failed to achieve any favorable results.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし大永4年（1524年）に安芸厳島に進出して佐東銀山城の攻防戦で尼子軍を撃破し、大永5年（1525年）には毛利元就が再び帰参したため、安芸における勢力をやや回復する。
sen.e: Nevertheless, he entered Aki Itsukushima and annihilated Amago army at Sato-Kanayama Castle battle in 1524, and he recovered the power at Aki a little with the return of Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA in 1525.

However, in 1524, he advanced to Aki Itsukushima and annihilated the Amago army at the battle for Sato-Kanayama Castle, and in 1525, with the return of Motonari MORI, he recovered somewhat power in Aki.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentenceCorrected 'Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA' to 'Motonari MORI'
sen.e: However, in 1524, he advanced to Aki Itsukushima and annihilated the Amago army at the battle for Sato Kanayama-jo Castle, and in 1525, with the return of Motonari MORI, he recovered somewhat power in Aki.
sen.cmt: 調査指示書の入力要領に従い修正 Sato-Kanayama Castle → Sato Kanayama-jo Castle

sen.j: また、尼子氏も山陰方面で山名氏らとの戦いもあったため、石見における勢力も義興は奪い返した。
sen.e: Since Amago clan also fought with Yamana clan at San-in district, Yoshioki snatched back the control of Iwami.
Since the Amago clan had fought the Yamana clan at San-in district, Yoshioki took back control of Iwami.
sen.cmt: Added 'the'Added 'had'Deleted 'also'Deleted 'the''snatched'→'took'
sen.e: Since the Amago clan had fought the Yamana clan at San-in district, Yoshioki took back control of Iwami as well.
sen.cmt: 「石見における勢力も」の「も」が訳漏れのため、as well を追記

sen.j: さらに北九州の少弐資元らとも戦い、有利に戦況を進めている。
sen.e: He also battled with Sukemoto SHONI of Kitakyushu and led the war to his favorable side.
He also gained favorable results in his battle with Sukemoto SHONI of Kitakyushu.
sen.cmt: Rewrote sentence
sen.e: He also gained favorable results in his battle with Sukemoto SHONI of northern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: Kitakyushu → northern Kyushu

sen.j: 享禄元年（1528年）、安芸門山城攻めで病に倒れ、山口に帰還直後に死去した。
sen.e: He fell ill at the invasion of Aki-Kadoyama Castle in 1528 and died immediately after returning to Tamaguchi.
He fell ill during an attack on Aki-Kadoyama Castle in 1528 and died immediately after returning to Yamaguchi.
sen.cmt: at the invasion of'→'during an attack on'Corrected 'Tamaguchi' to Yamaguchi'
sen.e: He fell ill during an attack on Aki Kadoyama-jo Castle in 1528 and died immediately after returning to Yamaguchi.
sen.cmt: 調査指示書の入力要領に従い修正 Aki-Kadoyama Castle → Aki Kadoyama-jo Castle

sen.j: 享年52。
sen.e: He died at the age of 52.
He died at the age of 52.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: He died at the age of 52.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 後を嫡男の大内義隆が継いだ。
sen.e: His progeny, Yoshitaka OUCHI, succeeded him.
He was succeded by his heir, Yoshitaka OUCHI.
sen.cmt: Rewrote sentence
sen.e: He was succeded by his heir, Yoshitaka OUCHI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 「人物」 Character → Personal Profile

sen.j: 義興は公家のような人物だったといわれる。
sen.e: Yoshioki was supposedly a Kuge (court noble)-like person.
Yoshioki was said to be a Kuge (court noble)-like person.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: Yoshioki was said to be a person like a court noble.
sen.cmt: trans2 comment 抜け用語集の表記に従い修正、および語順を入れ替えa Kuge (court noble)-like person → a person like a court noble

sen.j: ただし、だからといって軟弱な人物ではなく、その生涯を戦陣の中で過ごした英雄である。
sen.e: However, it did not define him as a weak person but as a hero who spent his life at the battle fields.
However, this did not mean he was a weak person, as he was a hero who spent his life on the battlefield.
sen.cmt: it did not define him as'→'this did not mean he was''but as a hero who spent his life at the battle fields'→'as he was a hero who spent his life on the battlefield'
sen.e: However, this did not mean he was a weak person, as he was a hero who spent his life on the battlefield.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: むしろ、自らを公家のように振舞うことで、京都の戦火を逃れてやってくる公家を山口に迎えて朝廷とのパイプを作り、さらに京都文化を山口で開花させて、山口文化（大内文化）を創出させた。
sen.e: Instead by acting like Kuge, he invited kuge who escaped from battle fires at Kyoto to Tamaguchi to make a connection with the Imperial court and flourished the Kyoto culture at Tamaguchi to establish the Yamaguchi culture (Ouchi culture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Instead, by acting like the Kuge and making connections with the Imperial court by inviting Kuge who had escaped war in Kyoto to Yamaguchi, Kyoto culture flourished in Yamaguchi, leading to the establishment of Yamaguchi culture (Ouchi culture).
sen.cmt: Reworded sentenceCorrected 'Tamaguchi' to Yamaguchi'
sen.e: Instead, by acting like a court noble and making connections with the Imperial court by inviting court nobles who had escaped war in Kyoto to Yamaguchi, Kyoto culture flourished in Yamaguchi, leading to the establishment of Yamaguchi culture (Ouchi culture).
sen.cmt: 用語集の表記に修正the Kuge → a court noble

sen.j: 領国を「西の小京都」と呼ばれるまでに繁栄させるなど、大内氏の全盛期を築き上げた人物である。
sen.e: This fluorished his estate to be eventually called as the 'Sho-Kyoto (little Kyoto) of the West,' and he is a person who led to the height of prosperity for Ouchi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His estate eventually came to be called the 'Little Kyoto of the West,' and the Ouchi clan had its heyday under his leadership.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence.Deleted 'Sho-Kyoyo'
sen.e: His estate eventually came to be called the 'Little Kyoto of the West,' and the Ouchi clan had its heyday under his leadership.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上洛を果たしていながら、後の織田信長のように畿内で確固たる地盤を築き上げなかった理由は、領国の周防が京都から遠隔地すぎたこと、大内氏自体が国人の盟主的存在という構造的問題などがあったためと思われる。
sen.e: The reason why he could not form the firm foundation of power similar to Nobunaga ODA despite Joraku was because his Suo estate was too far away from Kyoto and the structural problem of Ouchi Clan being the direct leader of Kokujin (people of the country).

Despite controlling Kyoto, he was unable to use it to form a strong base as Nobunaga ODA did because his Suo estate was too far away from Kyoto and because of structural problems relating to the Ouchi clan's position as leaders of the kokumin class of samurai.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentenceNot sure of the translation of the final clause
sen.e: Despite controlling Kyoto, he was unable to use it to form a strong base in Kinai region as Nobunaga ODA did because his Suo estate was too far away from Kyoto and because of structural problems relating to the Ouchi clan's position as leaders of kokujin (local samurai).
sen.cmt: 「畿内で」訳漏れのため Kinai region を追記「国人」 the kokumin class of samurai→ kokujin (local samurai)

sen.j: そのため、義興の天下人としての君臨は畿内にいた期間に限られていた。
sen.e: As a result, the time duration that Yoshioki reigned as the ruler of the land that he conquered was limited.
As a result, Yoshioki's time as the de facto ruler was limited to the length of his stay in the Kyoto area.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentenceDeleted 'duration''ruler of the land that he conquered'→'de facto ruler'
sen.e: As a result, Yoshioki's time as the de facto ruler was limited to the length of his stay in Kinai region.
sen.cmt: 「畿内」 the kyoto area → Kinai region

tit.e: History of the Governmental Post Rank
History of the Governmental Post Rank
History of the Governmental Post Rank

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: *Dating system=old lunar calendar
*Dating system=old lunar calendar
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: *Dating system=old lunar calendar
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 年月不明 従五位下・周防介
sen.e: Unknown date: Jugoi-no-ge rank, Suo-no-suke (ruler of Suo)
Unknown date: Lower Fifth rank, Suo-no-suke (ruler of Suo)
sen.cmt: Jugoi-no-ge'→'Lower fifth'― not sure if this and following titles need translating
sen.e: Unknown date: Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Suo no suke (Assistant Governor of Suo Province)
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正 「従五位下」 Lower Fifth rank → Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)用語集掲載用語に統一 「周防介」 Suo-no-suke (ruler of Suo) → Suo no suke (Assistant Governor of Suo Province)

sen.j: 年月不明 左京大夫
sen.e: Unknown date: Sakyo-no-daifu
Unknown date: Sakyo-no-daifu
sen.cmt: daifu'→'daibu'
sen.e: Unknown date: Sakyo no daibu
sen.cmt: Sakyo-no-daibu → Sakyo no daibu

sen.j: 1495年（明応4年）周防・長門･石見三箇国守護職
sen.e: 1495: Suo, Nagato, Iwami Shugoshoku Title
1495: Governor of Suo, Nagato, Iwami
sen.cmt: Shugoshoku Title'→'Governor'
sen.e: 1495: Shugoshiki (military governor) of three Provinces; Suo, Nagato and Iwami
sen.cmt: 「三箇国」訳漏れのため追記「守護職」 Governor → Shugoshiki (military governor)and を追記

sen.j: 1496年（明応5年）筑前国守護職兼職
sen.e: 1496: Assigned additionally to Chikuzen-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title
1496: Added title of Governor of Chikuzen-no-kuni
sen.cmt: Assigned additionally to Chikuzen-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title'→'Added title of Governor of Chikuzen-no-kuni'
sen.e: 1496: Added title of Shugoshiki of Chikuzen Province
sen.cmt: 「守護職」 Governor → Shugoshiki (※補足説明は81行目で既出のため省略)統一リストの表記に修正 Chikuzen-no-kuni → Chikuzen Province

sen.j: 1507年（永正4年） 安芸国守護職兼職
sen.e: 1507: Assigned additionally to Aki-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title
1507: Added title of Governor of Aki-no-kuni
sen.cmt: Assigned additionally to Aki-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title'→'Added title of Governor of Aki-no-kuni'
sen.e: 1507: Added title of Shugoshiki of Aki Province
sen.cmt: 「守護職」 Governor → Shugoshiki (※補足説明は81行目で既出のため省略)統一リストの表記に修正 Aki-no-kuni → Aki Province

sen.j: 1508年（永正5年）6月8日、足利義稙を奉じて入京。
sen.e: June 8, 1508: He did nyukyo (enter Kyoto) while serving Yoshitane ASHIKAGA.
June 8, 1508: Entered Kyoto in service of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: He did nyukyo (enter Kyoto) while serving '→'Entered Kyoto in service of '
sen.e: June 8, 1508: Entered Kyoto in service of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 7月1日、幕府管領代に就任。
sen.e: July 1: Inaugurated to the shogunate Kanrei-dai
July 1: Assumed postion of Kanrei-dai
sen.cmt: Inaugurated to the shogunate'→'Assumed postion of'
sen.e: July 1: Assumed postion of Bakufu Kanreidai (representative of a shogunal deputy of the Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
sen.cmt: 「幕府管領代」：「幕府」の訳漏れBakufu Kanreidai (representative of a shogunal deputy of the Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) を追記文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 8月1日、従四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: August 1: Shojo (promotion in Jo rank) to Jushi-no-ge
August 1: Promoted to Lower Fourth rank
sen.cmt: Shojo (promotion in Jo rank) to Jushi-no-ge'→'Promoted to Lower fourth rank'
sen.e: August 1: Promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 「従四位下」 Lower Fourth rank → Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 左京大夫如元。
sen.e: He stayed as Sakyo-no-daibu rank.
Continued as Sakyo-no-daibu
sen.cmt: He stayed'→'Continued'Deleted 'rank'
sen.e: Continued as Sakyo no daibu.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 9月14日、従四位上に昇叙。
sen.e: September 14: Shojo to Jushi-no-jo
September 14: Promoted to Upper Fourth rank
sen.cmt: Shojo to Jushi-no-jo'→'Promoted to Upper fourth rank'
sen.e: September 14: Promoted to Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 「従四位上」 Upper Fourth rank → Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade)

sen.j: 左京大夫如元。
sen.e: He stayed as Sakyo-no-daibu rank.
Continued as Sakyo-no-daibu
sen.cmt: He stayed'→'Continued'Deleted 'rank'
sen.e: Continued as Sakyo no daibu.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 1509年（永正6年） 豊前国守護職兼職
sen.e: 1509: Assigned additionally to Buzen-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title
1509: Added title of Governor of Buzen-no-kuni
sen.cmt: Assigned additionally to Buzen-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title'→'Added title of Governor of Buzen-no-kuni'
sen.e: 1509: Added title of Shugoshiki of Buzen Province
sen.cmt: 「守護職」 Governor → Shugoshiki (※補足説明は81行目で既出のため省略)統一リストの表記に修正 Buzen-no-kuni → Buzen Province

sen.j: 1512年（永正9年）3月26日、従三位に昇叙。
sen.e: March 26, 1512: Shojo to Jusani rank
March 26, 1512: Promoted to Third rank
sen.cmt: Shojo to Jusani rank'→'Promoted to Third rank'
sen.e: March 26, 1512: Promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 「従三位」 Third rank → Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 左京大夫如元。
sen.e: He stayed as Sakyo-no-daibu rank.
Continued as Sakyo-no-daibu
sen.cmt: He stayed'→'Continued'Deleted 'rank'
sen.e: Continued as Sakyo no daibu.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除文末にピリオドを追記

sen.j: 1514年（永正11年）左京大夫去る。
sen.e: 1514: Leaves Sakyo-no-daibu.
1514: Resigns as Sakyo-no-daibu.
sen.cmt: Leaves→'Resigns as'
sen.e: 1514: Resigns as Sakyo no daibu.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを削除

sen.j: 1516年（永正13年）山城国守護職兼職
sen.e: 1516: Assigned additionally to Yamashiro-no-kuni Shogoshoku Title
1516: Added title of Governor of Yamashiro-no-kuni
sen.cmt: Assigned additionally to Yamashiro-no-kuni Shugoshoku Title'→'Added title of Governor of Yamashiro-no-kuni'
sen.e: 1516: Added title of Shugoshiki of Yamashiro Province
sen.cmt: 「守護職」 Governor → Shugoshiki (※補足説明は81行目で既出のため省略)統一リストの表記に修正 Yamashiro-no-kuni → Yamashiro Province

tit.j: 義興の偏諱を受けた人物
tit.e: People who received Henki (one letter from the name of the emperor, shogun, or daimyo given to the name of the servant for his high achievements or when he becomes an adult) of Yoshioki
tit.cmt: 偏諱→henki (one letter from the name of the emperor, shogun, or daimyo given to the name of the servant for his high achievements or when he becomes an adult)[http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/175624/m0u/偏諱/]
tit.e: People who received Henki (the custom of awarding one character from one's name to a subordinate in recognition of their service) from Yoshioki
People who received Henki (the custom of awarding one character from one's name to a subordinate in recognition of their service) from Yoshioki

Okitsune KIKAWA

Okikage KOBAYAKAWA

Okifusa SUE
